content.body: what do we all think are the remaining blockers to seeking stage 2?
I suspect nothing? We should try to close the remaining issues, and make sure the spec text is up to date, but that's it.

The more I write and read examples, the more I think we could get away with dropping the () around the matcher, as long as we have the separator character. `when (${...})` is just a lot of wrappers, and I don't want to special-case top-level `${}` over other things.
content.formatted_body: The more I write and read examples, the more I think we could get away with dropping the () around the matcher, as long as we have the separator character. when (${...}) is just a lot of wrappers, and I don't want to special-case top-level ${} over other things.

content.body: `when ({foo})` or `when([foo])` too, just too many wrapper chars. Gimme `when {foo}: ...` and `when [foo]: ...`
content.formatted_body: when ({foo}) or when([foo]) too, just too many wrapper chars. Gimme when {foo}: ... and when [foo]: ...

content.body: so you want `when null` and `when /a/g` and `when 3` etc?
content.formatted_body: so you want when null and when /a/g and when 3 etc?

content.body: i think that it's a _reasonable_ possibility, now that the pin operator has boundaries, in a way where it was unreasonable with `^`
content.formatted_body: i think that it's a reasonable possibility, now that the pin operator has boundaries, in a way where it was unreasonable with ^

content.body: but i'm not sure it's better. the parens are a nice static delimiter to indicate the pattern
i guess we still haven't figured out if there should be a separator before the RHS, and what it is?
Yes, I'd want all of those, so long as we have the RHS separator.
And yeah we haven't figured it out yet, but it looked like several champions were leaning towards `:` the last time we discussed this.
content.formatted_body: And yeah we haven't figured it out yet, but it looked like several champions were leaning towards : the last time we discussed this.
